Key Match Events: England's bowlers were disciplined at the death to close out a 20-run victory.
Ben Stokes celebrated the wicket of New Zealand’s Kane Williamson.
Chris Jordan took boundary catches to see off Daryl Mitchell and Glenn Phillips.
Sam Curran's yorkers and bouncers restricted New Zealand to 159 for six.
Post-Match Reflections: England still need to beat Sri Lanka and hope Australia do not overhaul their net run-rate to secure a semi-final place.
This was a much-improved display from England after faltering against Ireland.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played on a used pitch.
Buttler was dropped twice during his innings.
Moeen Ali opened the bowling and found sharp turn.
England's fielding grew ragged at times, allowing New Zealand to turn ones into twos.
